definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]

sentences.english: They whispered to one another about the taffeta lining and about little mouse tippets.
sentences.chinese: 切切私语着塔夫绸的衬里还有关于老鼠的小披肩。

sentences.english: I will recover , i will hear it whisper back.
sentences.chinese: 我会转醒，我会再听到那切切私语。

sentences.english: Snuggle up close to him, and whisper sweet-nothings.
sentences.chinese: 依偎在他身上，开始甜甜的切切私语。

sentences.english: He'd pose with it, whiskers twitching , wile the women cooed their admiration.
sentences.chinese: 这情景惹得在场的女人们切切私语，羡慕不已。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
to discuss in whispered tones/whispered conversation
in a whisper/in a low voice (idiom)
to prick up one's ear and listen carefully
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth
to chat with a low voice
whispering in a low voice (idiom); murmuring
